author: stylesen
msg: * subversion/libsvn_client/copy.c

author: gstein
msg: Reorder some code. No functional change.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/wc_db.c:
(svn_wc__db_read_info): the OUT parameters are handled in the order they
appear in the param list. move the LOCK param processing down to its
proper place.

author: gstein
msg: Add more test cases for scan_deletion.
* subversion/tests/libsvn_wc/db-test.c:
(data_loading_sql): add more nodes to set up test scenarios
(test_scan_deletion): test the new scenarios

author: gstein
msg: Use scan_deletion to get information about the deletions in our test data
set. The data set also had some inconsistencies that needed to be
corrected.
- if a node is moved away, then it must exist in the BASE_NODE table. the
"J/J-e" subtree was moved, so rows were added to BASE_NODE
- the root of a WORKING subtree cannot be deleted, so switch "K" over to
be base-deleted and add a corresponding BASE node for it
* subversion/tests/libsvn_wc/db-test.c:
(data_loading_sql): add some BASE_NODE rows. fix presence of "K"
(test_base_children): J and K were added. bump to 11 children
(test_scan_deletion): add tests for each of the scenarios in the current
data set. additional tests will be added later.

author: gstein
msg: Fixes to the new scan_deletion function.
- deletions are recorded in the WORKING_NODE table, but there may not be a
corresponding BASE_NODE row (eg. deletion of a subtree of a copy). thus,
I had to swap the left/right tables in my outer join.
- adjust the scan logic to look for "no row" when we fall/scan off the top
of the WORKING tree scan
- at scan exit time, only set BASE_DEL_ABSPATH if there was a BASE_NODE
- make sure to reset the stmt
- when looking for a transition in the WORKING tree, check for not-present
rather than deleted (the latter is not a presence value)
* subversion/libsvn_wc/wc_db.c:
(statements): adjust the left/right tables for our presence query
(svn_wc__db_scan_deletion): algorithm fixes, per above
